name: Dapoxetine (Priligy)
summary: A short-acting SSRI approved in some countries for the treatment of premature ejaculation.
description: Dapoxetine is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) developed specifically for on-demand use in premature ejaculation (PE). Unlike other SSRIs used daily for depression or anxiety, dapoxetine is rapidly absorbed and eliminated, allowing for dosing 1–3 hours before sexual activity. It is not approved for depression due to its short half-life.

items: On-demand treatment of premature ejaculation in men aged 18–64 years

sections.text: Dapoxetine inhibits the serotonin transporter (SERT), increasing serotonin levels in the synaptic cleft. This enhances control over ejaculation latency through central nervous system effects on ejaculatory reflex pathways.

adult.premature-ejaculation: 30 mg taken 1–3 hours before sexual activity; may increase to 60 mg if tolerated and needed

sections.hepatic_impairment: Contraindicated in moderate to severe impairment
sections.renal_impairment: Use with caution in severe impairment

sections.text: Onset within 1–3 hours; half-life 1.5 hours (elimination half-life for active metabolites up to ~20 hours).

other: Risk of syncope, especially within 3 hours after dosing
Avoid in patients with significant cardiac conditions

sections.pregnancy: Not indicated for use in women
sections.pediatrics: Not approved for patients under 18 years
sections.geriatrics: Not recommended due to lack of data and higher risk of adverse effects

sections.text: Not required due to on-demand use.

items: Only SSRI specifically developed and approved for premature ejaculation
Combination with PDE5 inhibitors should be approached cautiously due to potential hypotension

seo.description: Dapoxetine (Priligy) is a short-acting SSRI used on-demand to treat premature ejaculation in adult men.
